name: Rameshwaram

deity.mythology_link: Linked with Rama worshipping Shiva in the Ramayana tradition

location.sacred_geography: On Pamban island in the Gulf of Mannar region, associated with Ramayana pilgrimage routes
location.access: Connected by road and rail via Pamban bridge links

significance.rank: Eleventh Jyotirlinga and one of the four Char Dham destinations
significance.philosophy: Rameshwaram symbolizes the devotional unity of Rama and Shiva traditions.
significance.scriptural_reference: Ramayana, Shiva Purana, regional Sthala Purana traditions

stats.daily_visitors: Varies by season and festival calendar
stats.annual_visitors: Very high annual footfall as a national pilgrimage center
stats.unique_feature: Known for one of the world's longest temple corridor systems and 22 theerthams

description: Ramanathaswamy Temple at Rameshwaram is among India's most important Shiva shrines, revered both as a Jyotirlinga site and as part of the Char Dham circuit. The temple is especially known for its long corridor architecture and ritual bathing traditions at the 22 theerthams within the complex.
secret_hook: Rameshwaram's sea-facing geography, corridor architecture, and Ramayana-linked worship make it a uniquely layered pilgrimage destination.
